english: to part/separate; to distinguish; other; don't (imperative)

etymology.description: 會意: 冎 “bone” + 刂 “knife”, hence 𠛰 ‘to cut up bone and flesh’; later stylized as 別. 别 is a variant where 𠮠 is replaced with visually similar 另; officially adopted in 1956 as the simplified form of 彆.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the ideas of bone and knife to depict cutting apart, which extends to meanings like separating and distinguishing. Over time the form was streamlined, and modern 别 uses 另 on the left for ease and resemblance to the older shape.
etymology.simplification: The left component 𠮠 was replaced by 另 to reduce strokes and improve legibility; PRC reform also merged 彆/別 to the single simplified form 别 (1956).

examples.chinese: 我们走别的路吧(我們走別的路吧)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zǒu bié de lù ba.

examples.chinese: 天色已晚(天色已晚)，我们在车站分别吧(我們在車站分別吧)。
examples.pinyin: Tiānsè yǐ wǎn, wǒmen zài chēzhàn fēnbié ba.
examples.english: It's getting late; let's part at the station.
